alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 11:24AM EDT until June 16 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL CHESTER COUNTY... At 1123 AM EDT, a severe squall line capable of producing both tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage was located over Glenmoore, or 12 miles northwest of West Chester, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Elverson, Glenmoore and Pughtown. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 301 and 308. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
